newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ job ads trend rises slightly in October - ANZ.
newsitem.headline: NZ job ads trend rises slightly in October - ANZ.

text.p: The trend number of job ads rose 0.5 percent in October following a 2.3 percent fall in September, ANZ Bank said on Tuesday.
In annual terms, the trend number of job ads continued to fall, with October's number 5.4 percent below October 1995.

ANZ said job advertisements had risen slightly in Auckland during October. Wellington and Christchurch continued to experience a decline in monthly job ad figures, although of a smaller magnitude than previous months.
In annual terms the number of job advertisements continued to decline in all of the main centres.
The monthly trend in job ads in Auckland rose 1.1 percent in October, following a 0.3 percent rise in August. In annual terms, the trend number of job ads was three percent lower than a year ago.
Job ads in Wellington fell 0.5 percent on the previous month, and 17.9 percent on a year ago.
Christchurch also recorded a decline in October, falling 1.8 percent, with the trend number of job ads 8.2 percent below October 1995.

ANZ said the slowdown in job ads growth over the past year was consistent with the September quarter Household Labour Force Survey last week, which showed a continued decrease in the annual rate of employment growth, to 3.7 percent from 3.9 percent in the year to June.
"This slowdown in employment growth is expected to prevail over the remainder of 1996," ANZ said.
